snippet: Kim Seung-youn was convicted of embezzlement in a case that drew new attention to public mistrust in South Korea of the judiciary.
abstract: Seoul court sentences Hanwha chairman Kim Seung-youn to four years in prison for embezzlement and fines him 5.1 billion won; court makes rare decision to have him dispatched directly to prison; Kim's case drew new attention to public mistrust of the judiciary in South Korea.
lead_paragraph: Kim Seung-youn was convicted of embezzlement in a case that drew new attention to public mistrust in South Korea of the judiciary.

headline.main: Seoul Judge Surprises Tycoon With Prison Term
headline.print_headline: Head of South Korean Conglomerate Given 4-Year Term
